message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.CG. 

This paper deals with a graph problem that involves finding a set of vertices that avoids cycles containing a given set of vertices or edges. This is a classic problem in graph theory and can be applied to various fields such as network design and optimization. The paper uses matroid-based tools, which are commonly used in algorithms and combinatorics, to obtain a polynomial kernel for the problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The problem also involves graph theory and combinatorics, which suggests cs.GT (Graph Theory) and cs.CG (Computational Geometry) as possible sub-categories.
